body.p:
Frankfort May 12th 1864
Gov Bramlette,
Hon. Sir

as you ar awair I have bin ^a^ unfortunet man I am blind. and I ask your Simperthe and Restore me to my friends I ashure you Sir that I will ever by graitfull to you and I shall ackt as a man Should. the ceapers I am Shure are willing to have me released and If you will be cind enuf and come to the prison I know that that the warden and ceapers will give you all the Information you wish I have bin hear ^Nearly^ five years. and have 5 to Stay I was sent from Louisville for Bourglery I have bin to your office But you wor not at the Office So I hope you will do all that is consistent with your good nature and may God in his goodness be with you and bless you Is a blind mans Blessing & Prair as I cannot Recale my past Life I will try ^to^ do better in the future.

I Remain your Humble Servant
Charles Sulivan

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Issue pardon
Tho E Bramlette
Charles Sulivan
Felony
5th May/64
